text: (gentle music)
- Louis-Phillipe Sirois from Montreal,
Inside Sales Representative.

I've been at AWS for
a year and a half now.
Before AWS, I was in inside sales as well
in another tech company.
Compared to where I was before,
the culture of AWS is quite different

in the aspect of your really
focused on your customer.
It's not necessarily a short term vision
but really looking at the long term

how you can help your
customer make an impact.
I think the dream job as a seller

you really wanna change
and help your customer,

so I think that's really
the biggest difference

that a newcomer would
feel in coming at AWS.

Where I think I've been
able to really be exposed
to that different way of thinking
within AWS is being an owner
of what I think should be fixed,
whether it be for a customer,
whether it be internal process,

I'm really able to explore
that and find solutions
and it's encouraged.

There's no like R key or like
no one's really telling you
not to do or say anything.
On the technical point of view

because of the portfolio AWS
is offering to the market,
you can really go in many directions.

There's not like one
solution that solves it all.
The role itself inside seller,
what is really, really unique about it
is we have full ownership.
We can operate as a seller,

engage directly with
customers, and whatnot.
It's not your typical inside sales jobs
where you might depend on someone else

and you're not fully
owner of that business.

I really, really enjoy the
inside sales role right now

'cause of that liberty I have
and engaging with customers.
(gentle music)
